text: beside praise there's a lot of other
finger food snacks that you can prepare
for your little one in this video i will
share with you a few healthy baby food
ideas that are suitable for babies from
8 months and toddlers baby food needs to
be rich in energy and nutrients so make
sure every meal includes grains
vegetables fruits oil fat and protein
the first recipe is salmon floss which
can be served at toppings for rice or
congee you will need salmon fresh milk
shallot and ginger remove the skin and
the bone of the salmon then soak in milk
for about 5-10 minutes to remove the
gummy smell then steam the salmon with
some shallots and ginger slices to boost
the flavor when it's cooked drain and
transfer to a mortar and pestle crush
well and then transfer to a non-stick
pan cook under very low heat and
constantly stirring until the salmon is
broken down into flakes when it's nice
and dry leave to cool and transfer to an
airtight container this can be kept in
the refrigerator for 2 to 4 weeks you
can also make this with mackerel instead
of salmon add to your baby's rice or
congee dishes to enhance the flavor and
nutrition some moms ask me why it's so
hard to feed their babies cooked rice
and i showed them my secrets because
cooked rice is very hard for babies to
pick up so i roll rice in roasted
seaweed and cut into small bite-sized
pieces like this it's much easier for
them to pick up and pop into their mouth
this one is also a lot easier to
incorporate other items into their diet
like you know avocado egg salmons etc
plus this mini sushi looks so cute your
baby's gonna ask for more you will need
some cooked rice a large piece of
roasted seaweed salmon flakes a small
piece of omelette and some avocado cut
the avocado into sticks cut the omelet
into strips add some sesame oil to the
steamed rice mix well and spread the
rice all over the roasted seaweed
sprinkle with the salmon flakes add the
avocado and omelette and arrange a crust
roll it up with a half of a sushi mat
then cut into tiny bite size pieces when
my babies were eight to nine months i
started feeding them with these mini
sushis they didn't enjoy being
spoon-feed but whenever they sushi they
were so excited to add more vegetables
and tofu to your little one's diet this
tofu and vegetable filters is really
awesome you can dice up all the
vegetables in different colors carrots
corn green peas beet roots swatch
zucchini opal watch etc you also need a
hundred gram of tofu one egg two
tablespoons of all purpose flour a dash
of salt or vegetable stock if your kid
is older than one year old in a last
mixing bowl crush the tofu and combine
with the rest of the diced vegetables
add the egg all purpose flour and a
pinch of salt or seasonings if your kit
is older than 1 years old mix well and
then heat up some oil in a pan scoop the
tofu and vegetable mixture and add to
the hot oil to fry use spatula to press
it down four minutes into small patties
fry until golden brown on both sides and
transfer to rest on a piece of kitchen
towel to drain off the excess oil for
dessert you can make these milk balls
they super cute soft and elastic you
will need 5 tablespoons of milk you can
add strawberries or chocolate depending
on the flavors that your baby is
enjoying you can also use breast milk or
formula to make it even more nutritious
then you will need 2 tablespoons of
cornstarch and some milk batter for
coating combine the cornstarch and milk
in a saucepan
add a little bit of oil and stir well
then turn on the stove and keep stirring
over low heat until it turns into a
paste and no longer stick to the pan
turn off the heat divide the paste into
smaller portions making two balls then
roll over the milk powder to avoid
sticking look at that they're super soft
and smooth nobody can turn away from
this you can add more fruits into their
meal by cutting into finger size sticks
then peel the skin halfway through
leaving some for them to hold on to you
can serve one foot at a time or combine
different items in their food tray and
let them enjoy the whole meal
one more healthy and nutritious snack is
this broccoli pancake which you can trim
into cute shapes you will need some
broccoli butter
one egg three tablespoon of milk powder
a tablespoon of purpose flour and a
pinch of cinnamon powder finely mince
the broccoli and combine in a bowl with
all purpose flour milk powder and egg
melt the butter in the pan then pour in
the mixture and tilt the pan to spread
the mixture evenly flip to cook both
sides then leave to cool and use cutters
to cut into the cute shapes i made this
for the first time when my son was seven
months old and he's enjoyed it so much
you can substitute the broccoli with
apple or bananas both of my kids really
love this one so you can give it a try
to see if your baby loves it too
[Music]
i hope this video gives you some more
ideas to make nutritious delicious and
healthy foods for your babies let me
know if they like it thank you for
watching and i will see you then next
time bye
[Music]
